title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Hi,

I have dead 820-00840. It had liquid damage around U2890 which I cleaned up and ran jumper wires etc. 5V on the USB C power meter.

I have:
PP3V3_G3H = 0.17V
PM_EN_P3V3_G3H_R = 0V

Neither are short to gnd. Any help from here would be appreciated.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Be sure all resistors around U2890 are OK and check continuity to its pins.
Possibly broken trace between U2800/90.
In such case, USB-C controllers never work.

Voltage to R7020?

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: Is PPDCIN 5 volts? If so, replace U7000 as it produces the enable for U6903.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: R7020 is 0V. Resistors are OK and have continuity to U2890.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS=5V but PPDCIN_G3H=0V. Don't I need this rail before U7000 is suspect? The power system on these boards makes my brain hurt.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: If you don?t even have PPDCIN check for a short on that line. Also for sure known good 87 watt USBC brick and cable? Also ports aren?t badly corroded?

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Compare voltage and resistance to ground (diode mode) at LDO outputs for both CD3215 chips.
Don't forget to check for short, or low value at PPDCIN_G3H.
Will be better if you have known good board, to compare all values.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 47236"]Compare voltage and resistance to ground (diode mode) at LDO outputs for both CD3215 chips.
Don't forget to check for short, or low value at PPDCIN_G3H.
Will be better if you have known good board, to compare all values.[/QUOTE]

No short on PPDCIN_G3H

Faulty board
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=0.486V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=0.498V

Good board
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=0.515V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=0.515V


[QUOTE="JohnB8812, post: 47232"]If you don?t even have PPDCIN check for a short on that line. Also for sure known good 87 watt USBC brick and cable? Also ports aren?t badly corroded? [/QUOTE]

No short to gnd on that line. Using a good 87W charger and cable.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Check all LDO lines.
And compare voltages too.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Good board (diode mode):
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD=0.483V
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=0.515V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA=0.525V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC=0.520V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD=0.484V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=0.515V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA=0.525V
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC=0.520V

Faulty board (diode mode):
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD=0V!
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=0.483V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA=0.526V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC=0V!
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD=0.494V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=0.495V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA=0.535V
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC=0V!

Faulty board (Voltages):
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD=0V
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=0.094V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA=0V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC=0V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD=0V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=1.547V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA=0V
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC=0V

I guess that's why I don't have PPDCIN_G3H.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
"PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD=0V!" (diode mode)
So you have a short there.
Check C3105, but I bet U3100 is the culprit...

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: You're right of course :) It was U3100. Now I gotta do some reballing. Thanks a lot for the help.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: Replaced U3100, I now have PPDCIN_G3H=5V. PP3V3_G3H is ~2.9V. When I plug the USB C power meter in to the port connected to U3100 I get 5V and ~400mA but on the port connected to U3200 I get 5V ~170mA. Does that sound like U3200 is bad as well or that I goofed soldering U3100?

message:

Faulty board (diode mode):

PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=3.325V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA=1.793V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC=0V

PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC=0V

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
When you check B port voltages, plug the charger on the corresponding USB-C port.
And compare again with good board.

PP3V3_G3H is low on both cases?
Check it on R6999.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Plugged into corresponding ports.
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD=1.8V
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO=3.3V
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA=1.8V
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC=0V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD=0.5V
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO=1.5V
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA=0V
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC=0V

PP3V3_G3H=0.1V when plugged into port corresponding to B and 2.9V when plugged into A.

Comparing the diode mode readings to the good board they are all very close.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: If diode mode readings are correct, voltage values point to internal problem of U3200...

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message: I'll replace U3200.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Replaced U3200, powers on and boots macos :)

Thanks very much for your help.

title: 820-00840 No PP3V3_G3H
message:
Glad to hear that.
These USB-C power problems are a nightmare...
